greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Edge-connectivity of the integer partition with Heinz number n.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1, ..., y_k) is prime(y_1) * ... * prime(y_k).
The edge-connectivity of an integer partition is the minimum number of parts that must be removed so that the prime factorizations of the remaining parts form a disconnected (or empty) hypergraph.
example: 2093 is the Heinz number of (9,6,4), corresponding to the multiset partition {{1,1},{1,2},{2,2}}, which can be made disconnected by removing only the part {1,2}, so a(2093) = 1.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Dec 04 2018
